steps.title: Background
steps.description:
We all have memories from the past that still affect us in a way that's not useful.

Experiences that seem to pop to our mind uninvited and, even tho you know logically it's over, it still affects you.

Some common examples are:

- childhood traumas
- arguments you keep running in your mind
- accidents and graphic scenes
- fights and people yelling

In a moment I'll walk you thru a short process but first you're probably wondering ...

answers.text: So how's this going to work Adam?

steps.title: Background - how
steps.description:
${echo}

I'm glad you asked :)

So here’s how this is going to work. I will ask you some questions, some more trivial than others, and offer you things to try.

Whatever works for you, keep, whatever doesn't, file away in the *"things I've tried and haven't worked for me yet"* drawer.

Sounds good?
steps.notes:
I will never impose anything on you. You only answer what you’re comfortable sharing, and only do what you’re comfortable doing.

Everything that we do is reversible, and we are only trying things to understand what works for YOU.

If at any point you feel uncomfortable, or something that we do isn’t to your liking, just message me, I respond personally to every single message I get.

I rely on your feedback to know how to proceed. Are we together on this?

answers.text: Yes
Sounds good!

steps.title: Background - privacy
steps.description: Most of what we’ll do together is content free, meaning I do NOT need the details of your experience, so you get total privacy.
steps.notes: I don't need the details of your memory we are about to soften, just a title for reference, i.e. "at the gym" is enough for me, as long as YOU know what memory it refers to.

answers.text: Fast & private results? Cool!
Great, I like that you respect privacy
OK

steps.title: Background - privacy+
steps.description: Needless to say (but here I go saying it anyways, just in case ...), **EVERYTHING in our interaction stays between us**. Whatever you write or say to me, stays only with me, unless you explicitly state otherwise.
steps.notes: I don’t share anything with anyone, no matter how close to me that person is, and how much I trust them. Privacy is SACRED. No one will even know we’ve worked together.

answers.text: Privacy IS sacred. I respect that.
I like that, and I'm OK sharing
OK, let's continue

steps.title: Background - Value first model & pricing
steps.description: You decide how much to pay AFTER you’ve gotten useful results and benefits from this process, and what you learn and experience in our time together. So no need to reach for your wallet quite yet ;)
steps.notes:
Most people who come to me have been through some personal change work that was slow, expensive, not very helpful, and many times harmful.

This is my only income, and I do need $$$ to continue helping & teaching people, but giving you better control over your mind, body, and internal processes is our #1 priority.

Sounds good? Are we together on this?

answers.text: Value first, I like it
That's an interesting model, mind expanding on that?
But Adam, I REALLY can’t spend a dime

steps.title: Background - Value first model & pricing
steps.description:
***"But Adam, I REALLY can’t spend a dime"***

It’s perfectly fine. Forget about that for now. After you got some very useful shifts and learnings with me, we can talk about it. Again, giving you more control & freedom is our #1 priority here.
steps.notes: So just relax and enjoy the ride okay?

answers.text: OK
Great, thank you!

steps.title: Name
steps.description: Great, now before you pick the first memory to turn around, tell me, what is your name?

steps.title: Eliciting past memory
steps.description: Okay ${s6}, think about a memory you had in the past, which pops to your mind every now and then, and still makes you feel bad, or in a way you don't want to (or still has a "sting" to it)
steps.notes: If this is about someone you lost, talk to me before proceeding

answers.text: Got one
This is about someone I lost

steps.title: Eliciting past memory - age
steps.description: And what was ${s6}'s age at that past memory?
steps.inputPlaceholder: In that past memory ${s6}'s age was ...

steps.title: Eliciting past memory - description
steps.description:
${echo}

Without getting into details, give me a title for reference.
steps.notes: i.e. "at the pool", "the alley behind school", etc

steps.title: Extending memory - background
steps.description:
My brother had an accident long ago with his motorcycle, while yours truly here was riding in the back.

(You can imagine how much my father appreciated his son, my brother, having a motorcycle ...)

A few seconds BEFORE the accident, there was no sign of any danger, and both me and my brother were perfectly ok.

Then the driver cut us off, there was the moment of the hit, some moments of confusion and stress, and after that we pulled over and exchanged details with the driver.

My leg wasn't 100% healed yet, but the accident itself was over, and both me and my brother were perfectly ok.

answers.text: OK, let's continue
OK, ready to extend my own memory

steps.title: Extending memory - before - elicitation
steps.description:
${echo}

OK, so I want you to think about a moment in time in which younger ${s6} had no sign of anything unusual about to happen, like I was before my accident.

It can be a few minutes, hours, days or week before that had happened:
*${s9}*

So you can see your younger self in there, having a neutral or positive.
steps.notes:
This is not scientific evidence we are gathering here, so don't worry about "getting it right" or "accurate". Anything that could've happened before and would make sense is fine.

You can go for something mundane as brushing your teeth a day before. Or watching a tv series you used to like, or having fun with a friend you had at the time.

You are not being graded on this. Promise ;)

answers.text: OK, I got a before moment
Not sure I got it right, but let's continue

steps.title: Extending memory - before - description
steps.description:
${echo}

Without getting into details, give me a title for reference.
steps.notes: i.e. "watching tv at home", "talking to my friend", etc

steps.title: Extending memory - before - validating
steps.description:
Now I want to be sure before we proceed, that in that moment:

*${s12}*

You can see younger ${s6} having a positive or neutral moment, with no sign of anything unusual about to come
steps.notes: Like I was before the motorcycle accident

answers.text: Yes, it’s a neutral moment, no sign for any unpleasantness
Yes, it’s a positive moment, no sign for any unpleasantness
You know what, let me choose another before moment

steps.title: Extending memory - after - elicitation
steps.description:
${echo}

Great, so now I want you to think about a neutral or positive moment in time, in which younger ${s6} was after everything that had happened, like I was after the accident, back on the motorbike with my brother.

My leg wasn't 100% healed yet at the time, but the danger and unpleasantness of that event are over.

It can be a few minutes, hours, days or week before that had happened:
*${s9}*

So you can see your younger self in there, having a neutral or positive.
steps.notes:
Remember this is not scientific evidence we are gathering here, so don't worry about "getting it right" or "accurate". Anything that could've happened after and would make sense is fine.

You can go for something mundane as brushing your teeth the next day (or week/month). Or watching a tv series you used to like, or having fun with a friend you had at the time.

You are not being graded on this.

answers.text: OK, I got an after moment
Not sure I got it right, but let's continue

steps.title: Extending memory - after - description
steps.description:
${echo}

Without getting into details, give me a title for reference.
steps.notes: i.e. "watching tv at home", "talking to my friend", etc

steps.title: Extending memory - after - validating
steps.description:
Now I want to be sure before we proceed, that in that moment:

“*${s15}*”

You can see younger ${s6} having a positive or neutral moment, after everything that had happened, like I was after the motorcycle accident

answers.text: Yes, it’s a neutral moment, after everything that had happened
Yes, it’s a positive moment, after everything that had happened
You know what, let me choose another after moment

steps.title: Setting the stage
steps.description:
Now think back on the “before” moment:
*${s12}*

And allow an image to comes to mind

answers.text: OK, I see the image

steps.title: Setting the stage - dissociation
steps.description:
So first I want you to freeze that image and dissociate from it, so you see younger ${s6} “over there”, in 3rd person, having a neutral or positive moment before, in a small black & white muted screen far far away.

Make that screen slightly out of focus and low resolution, like in Youtube where you select the lowest resolution you know?

Do it now, and let me know when you're done.
steps.notes: For extra credit, make the screen a bit transparent as well.

answers.text: OK, I see my younger self in the small screen far away

steps.title: Setting the stage - further dissociation
steps.description:
Now as you look at your younger self in that far away screen, make sure it’s already:

- 3rd person
- Still image
- The screen is black & white
- The screen is very far away
- The screen is muted
- The screen is a bit out of focus and low resolution
- The screen is faded out a bit
steps.notes: - The screen is transparent (extra credit)

answers.text: It was already like that
Made some adjustments, now it’s like that

steps.title: Fast forwarding cartoons
steps.description:
Good,
Now in a moment I’ll ask you to watch your younger self “over there”, in the small far away black and white screen, being fast forwarded from the before moment:

*“${s12}”*

through everything that has happened, and freeze it at the end, so you see your younger self in the after moment again:

*“${s15}”*

Now, know the sound of fast forwarding a cartoon?

answers.text: Fast forwarding a cartoon, of course! funny sound
Yes I do, let's continue

steps.title: Fast forwarding before -> after
steps.description:
Great, so here's what I want you to do:

1. See your younger self in the small screen far far away, frozen in time, at the before moment, before anything had happened, having a neutral or positive moment.

2. Make sure the screen is black & white, out of focus, faded out, transparent a little bit, and decrease the resolution. 

3. Mute the sound.

4. Allow your younger self to be fast forwarded in that movie as fast as you can, all the way from the before moment, through everything that had happened, to after everything is over, and you see your younger self in the after moment, having a neutral or positive moment again

5. Like a cartoon, hear everything going forward very fast

Do it now, and let me know when you're done.

answers.text: It’s so different watching it this way
That was interesting ...
Watched myself being fast forwarded, what's next?

steps.title: Fast forwarding validation
steps.description:
${echo}

Now I want to make sure that you watched your younger self "over there", in 3rd person, being fast forwarded from the before moment, all the way through what has happened, to the after moment, after everything is over,

and,

you see your younger self right now in the after moment, having a neutral or positive moment, in the small far away black & white faded out muted screen, correct?

answers.text: Correct
Actually, let me do it again, just in case

steps.title: War in reverse is ...
steps.notes:
I just heard it in a seminar the other day, and it made perfect sense to me.

The flames of destruction would package themselves back into bombs, which would return to the plane, which will return to the base and get unpacked.

All the weapons and ammunition get shipped back to the factories to be disassembled to raw materials.

Soldiers would go back home, kiss their partners, hug their loved ones.

Did you ever think of that?

answers.text: That's actually quite interesting …
Yes I have
OK, let's continue

steps.title: Rewinding after -> before
steps.description:
Now in a moment I'll ask you do to something interesting, and don't do it until I tell you to, okay?

I will want you to step inside the after moment, after everything was over, being ok, into your own body, so you see what you saw at the time, in color, in 1st person, hear what you heard and ...

Allow the memory to run in reverse as fast as you can, all the way to the before moment:

*${s12}*
steps.notes:
So you hear everyone talking backwards, see everything and everyone moving backwards in reverse, as fast as you can.

(yes you guessed it, like a cartoon, if you wish)

We gonna do it this way one time, then add some decorations.

So here are the steps again:

1. Step inside the end of the memory, into your own body, in 1st person,  being okay.

2. See what you saw at the time, in color, hear what you heard.

3. Allow the memory to rewind as fast as you can, hear everyone talking backwards, see everything and moving backwards in reverse, as fast as you can, like a cartoon, all the way to before the beginning, where you're okay again.

Close your eyes and do it now, let me know when you're done.

answers.text: Done and done!
I experienced the memory in reverse
Did it, that was funky!

steps.title: Rewinding validation
steps.description:
So now you’re back in the before moment:

“*${s12}*”

Correct?

answers.text: Correct
Actually, let me do that again

steps.title: Rewinding validation
steps.description:
Great,
And you experienced everything in reverse in 1st person, through your own eyes, correct?

answers.text: In 1st person, through my own eyes, yes
Actually I saw myself from the outside, in 3rd person

steps.title: Rewinding validation
steps.description:
Good, some people prefer to first experience it this way, before doing it through their own eyes in 1st person.

So put yourself back in the “after” moment:

“*${s15}*”

And I’ll redirect you to the previous step, to rewind it through your own eyes in 1st person.

answers.text: OK, I’m back in the after memory

steps.title: Embellishments - adding sound
steps.description:
Now let's make it even better.

I want you to think about a tune you enjoy, or a voice/sound that makes you feel good in anyway.
steps.notes:
You can use ANYTHING you like, that makes you laugh, feel silly, comfort, powerful, curious, whatever it is.

For many people the circus theme song works magic:
[zjedLeVGcfE](YtEmbedd)

Some go for people laughing:
[yLmd0100T9g](YtEmbedd)

Others go for the voice of a good friend, a comedian, or a cartoon.

Let me know when you got a tune/voice/sound you enjoy. No need for details, a title for reference will do.

steps.title: Embellishments - enriching sound

answers.text: I hear it much richer now
It’s much more impacting this way
Actually let me choose a different sound/tune/voice

steps.title: Embellishments - rewinding with sound
steps.description:
${echo}

Now as you hear it in this way, allow the sound to lead you back to the after moment:

*“${s15}”*

Make sure you are inside it, in 1st person , through your own eyes, seeing everything in color, and experience everything in reverse again, as you let the sound of *${s28}* lead you through it, until you are back again at the “before” moment:

*“${s12}*”

Close your eyes and do it now, and let me know when you’re back at the “before” moment.

answers.text: Done and done!
It's even better with the tune
It was logistically harder
Let me do it again real quick

steps.title: Embellishments - adding touch
steps.description:
${echo}

Great, next I want you to think about something you like the touch of, that makes you feel good in any way shape or form.
steps.notes:
A pet usually works very well, either yours or an animal you know and love. Some people go for something soft, velvet, blanket, or a pillow. Others go for a hug of someone close.

Whatever it is you enjoy the sense of touch of.

No need for details, a title for reference will do.

steps.title: Embellishments - enriching touch

answers.text: I feel it much richer now
It’s much more impacting this way
Actually, let me choose something else

steps.title: Embellishments - rewinding with touch
steps.description:
${echo}

Now as you feel it this way, start hearing the sound as well:
*${s28}*

And allow the sense of touch and sound to lead you back to the after moment:

*“${s15}”*

Make sure you are inside it, in 1st person , through your own eyes, seeing everything in color, and experience everything in reverse again, as you let the sound and touch to lead you through it, until you are back again at the “before” moment:

*“${s12}”*

Close your eyes and do it now, and let me know when you’re back at the “before” moment.

answers.text: Done and done!
It's even better with the touch
It was logistically harder
Let me do it again real quick

steps.title: Embellishments - taste or smell?
steps.description: For the next step, you prefer to add taste or smell?

answers.text: taste
smell

steps.title: Embellishments - adding ${s34}
steps.description: Great, so I want you to think about something you like the ${s34} of, that makes you feel good in any way shape or form.
steps.notes:
Whatever it is you enjoy the sense of ${s34} of.

No need for details, a title for reference will do.

steps.title: Embellishments - enriching ${s34}
steps.description:
As you begin to sense that ${s34} now:
${echo}
steps.notes: Make sure you experience it fully, and really attend to the sensations, and all that is associated with that ${s34}.

answers.text: I ${s34} it much richer now
It’s much more impacting this way
Actually, let me choose something else

steps.title: Embellishments - rewinding with ${s34}
steps.description:
${echo}

Now as you feel it this way, start sensing the touch as well:
*${s31}*

 hearing the sound:
*${s28}*

And allow the sense of ${s34}, touch and sound to lead you back to the after moment:

*“${s15}”*

Make sure you are inside it, in 1st person , through your own eyes, seeing everything in color, and experience everything in reverse again, as you let the ${s34}, sound and touch to lead you through it, until you are back again at the “before” moment:

*“${s12}”*

Close your eyes and do it now, and let me know when you’re back at the “before” moment.

answers.text: Done and done!
It's even better with the ${s34}
It was logistically harder
Let me do it again real quick

steps.title: Another run?
steps.description: Do you want to do one or some of the steps again?
steps.notes: This is totally up to you, if you feel you will benefit from it, It never hurts, and it’s easier and more automatic each time you do it anyway.

answers.text: Fast forward again
Rewind again
Rewind with sound again
Rewind with touch again
Rewind with touch/smell again
I’m good for now, let’s continue

steps.title: Congruence check
steps.description:
And what happens now, as you think of that past memory we started with?

*“${s9}”*
steps.notes: **Note**: We'll cover learnings and future safety mechanism next

answers.text: It’s much softer / better
It’s more accepting / loving
My mind rewinds back to the before moment
There's no improvement whatsoever
Other

steps.title: Learnings & future safety mechanism
steps.description:
${echo}

Now often times it's much easier and insightful to learn from our past negative experiences, when we can revisit them in a more positive and resourceful way, and we have more emotional freedom.

So looking back at this experience you just transformed:

*${s9}*

Are there any learnings you can make from it?
Or a safety mechanism you can install for the future, in order to better protect yourself from similar experiences?
steps.notes:
Many times we say things like "I should've seen that coming", "I should've known better", etc. So one way to think about it now is, **how** can you see it coming in the future.

What signs can you perceive in the future, that will alert you to potential future unpleasantness?

answers.text: I have some learnings to pick up from this experience
I have some future safety mechanisms to install
Nothing left to learn, let's continue

steps.title: Learnings & future safety mechanism - description
steps.description:
${echo}

Great, what are those?
steps.notes: This is actually a place where the more you write the better you will be, BUT, your privacy comes first, always, so you can also use titles for references, i.e. "watch for behavior X" or "pay extra attention when X happens"

steps.title: Learnings & future safety mechanism - future pacing

answers.text: Oh yes, it's much better being this way!
It's better
Actually, let me make some modifications

steps.title: Congruence check
steps.description:
${echo}

Do you have any objections being this way, experiencing these events like that?

answers.text: Objections? Of course not!
I LOVE being this way
No objections
Yes, I have an objection
